botanical_details.potentially_harmful: May cause severe discomfort if ingested. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Lupinus can be annuals, perennials or shrubs, with palmate leaves and showy terminal racemes of pea-like flowers

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in light, ideally slightly acidic, well-drained soil; prefers full sun but will tolerate part shade. Water well in summer dry spells. Tall plants may require support (see staking: perennials)
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate from basal softwood cuttings in mid spring. As this plant is protected by Plant Breeders' Rights, any propagation should be for personal rather than commercial use
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead to encourage a second flush of flowers
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to lupin aphid, slugs and snails
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to powdery mildews, lupin anthracnose and virus diseases
